citeinfo.origin: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) and Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC), Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI), Center for Spatial Analysis
citeinfo.title: Florida Aquatic Preserves

descript.abstract: This GIS data set represents aquatic preserves (AP) in the State of Florida. The Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) originally created Aquatic Preserves (AP) in the State of Florida from legal descriptions using 1:24000 scale shoreline. Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) Coastal and Aquatic Managed Areas (CAMA) now maintains the data set. Aquatic preserves are ecologically significant submerged lands maintained in relatively pristine condition.
descript.purpose: Divisions within the Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) have felt the need to develop digital coverages for the state-owned or managed properties they oversee and are in the process of reducing the legal descriptions on deeds into a digital form by interpreting and transferring the legal description to a quad sheet or using one or another of the COordinate GeOmetry (COGO) systems. These lands include the Aquatic Preserves and the State Park boundaries. Where possible, to minimize duplication of effort, the Department acquired the boundaries already created for the Aquatic Preserves.
descript.supplinf: Prior to July 1, 2004, the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) was known as the Florida Marine Research Institute (FMRI). The institute name has not been changed in historical data sets or references to work completed by the Florida Marine Research Institute. The institute name has been changed in references to ongoing research, new research, and contact information. Aquatic Preserve (AP) information is available in two different versions. This version contains AP information maintained by Coastal and Aquatic Managed Areas (CAMA). AP information is also available in the Outstanding Florida Waters layer. Currently, all APs are also Outstanding Florida Waters (OFWs). This was not the case in the past and may change again in the future, but an AP was dropped. It's important to note that there are three APs whose OFW boundaries differ from the AP boundary. These are described more specifically in the OFW rule 62-302.700. The Indian River Malabar to Vero expansion does not include portions of Sebastion and Turkey Creeks. The Wekiva River does not include portions of the St.Johns River. In the Big Bend, the OFW rule specifies certain "incorporated and unincorporated areas that are excluded." Please note that Boca Ciega Bay Aquatic Preserve is also part of the Pinellas County Aquatic Preserve. (previous geoform was 'vector digital data')

timeperd.current: These data were most recently updated in 2003

place.placekey: St. Johns River Water Management District

idinfo.accconst: Available without restriction. All data must be verified by Principle Investigator or Group Database Analyst prior to release. It is strongly recommended that this data is directly acquired from FWC and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. FWC makes no claims as to the data's suitability for other purposes.
idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgement of the FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute) as the data source, and the originator FDEP, would be appreciated in any products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected by users of this data. Please cite the original metadata when using portions of the record to create a similar record of slightly altered data, such as reprojection. If any data are modified or adjusted, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in mapping conventions, data collection, and computer processes over time. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of this data. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation.

srcinfo.srccitea: FL-Department of Environmental Protection, Coastal and Aquatic Managed Areas
srcinfo.srccontr: Provided legal descriptions for polygon generation.

procstep.procdesc: Points taken from legal descriptions and polygons were generated in ArcInfo. Aquatic Preserve boundaries were originally created by then FMRI using COGO (COordinate GeOmetry) methods.
procstep.srcused: FL-Department of Environmental Protection, Coastal and Aquatic Managed Areas

cntperp.cntorg: FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute)

cntaddr.address: Fish and Wildlife Research Institute 100 Eighth Avenue Southeast

procstep.procdesc: In the 2003 update provided by FDEP, the western boundary of Pinellas County Aquatic Preserve was adjusted to follow the coastline of Pinellas County. Lake Weir was removed. Biscayne Bay Aquatic Preserve was divided into Biscayne Bay Aquatic Preserve and Biscayne Bay-Cape Florida to Monroe County Line Aquatic Preserve. Boundaries were broadened for Tomoka Marsh Aquatic Preserve, North Fork St. Lucie Aquatic Preserve, and Loxahatchee Key-Lake Worth Creek Aquatic Preserve. In each case, the description designated all sovereignty submerged lands within specific boundaries. The boundary was extended out to those specific boundaries rather than attempting to determine if the previous boundary actually represented the full extent of sovereign submerged lands.
Librarian coverage was transformed from NAD27 to HPGN using the PROJECT command.
Shapefile of this dataset was inserted into Spatial Database Engine (SDE 3.0.2).
Four Lake Weir polygons were removed to reflect the delisting of Lake Weir. Additionally, 1,812 unnecessary polygons with NAME = 'NOT PRESERVE' were removed.

Boundaries for BIG BEND SEAGRASSES AQUATIC PRESERVE, OKLAWAHA RIVER AQUATIC PRESERVE, and PINELLAS COUNTY AQUATIC PRESERVE were replaced by updated boundaries reworked by Earl Pearson of the Office of Coastal and Aquatic Managed Areas and approved by Kathleen Swanson of ERP

attr.attrdef: Aquatic preserves are water by definition; however, some "land" areas are included in this data set. This is due to either a limitation in the data model used to create the data set, or in some cases, the boundaries of aquatic preserves were drawn as indicated in legal descriptions, and the exact extent of submerged lands within the given boundaries was not verified. See also the second Process Step.

attrdomv.udom: Character string given the name of the aquatic preserve.

attr.attrdef: Area of polygon (in square meters); SDE automatically calculates
Length of polygon perimeter (in meters); SDE automatically calculates

distinfo.distliab: This data set is in the public domain, and the recipient may not assert any proprietary rights thereto nor represent it to anyone as other than a FWC-FWRI produced data set; it is provided "as-is" without warranty of any kind, including, but not limited to, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. The user assumes all responsibility for the accuracy and suitability of this data set for a specific application. In no event will the staff of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute be liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use this data set.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer
